title: The One With the Breast Milk

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Carol and Susan are showing off Ben to the gang.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (entering from her bedroom carrying a present) Ok, these were unbelievably expensive, and I know he's gonna grow out of them in like, 20 minutes, but I couldn't resist. (There a little pair of Nike shoes.)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, look at these! Hey, Ben. Just do it. (Ben starts to cry) Oh my God, oh, ok, was that too much pressure for him?

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Oh, is he hungry already?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: I guess so. (Carol starts to breast feed Ben.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You know, it's... (sees the feeding taking place next to him) something funny about sneakers. I'll be right back. (Goes into the kitchen)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (joins him) I gotta get one, too.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (following them into the kitchen) What are you guys doing?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: We're just hanging out by the spoons. Ladle?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look, would you guys grow up? That is the most natural beautiful thing in the world.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, we know, but there's a baby suckin' on it.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: This is my son having lunch, ok? It's gonna happen a lot, so you'd better get used to it. Now if you have any problem with it, if you're uncomfortable, just ask questions. Carol's fine with it, now come on.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Carol?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Carol? I was just wondering if Joey could ask you a question about breast-feeding?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Sure.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Uh, does it hurt?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: It did at first, but not anymore.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Chandler?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So, uh, how often can you do it?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: As much as he needs.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ok, I got one, I got one. Uh, if he blows into one, does the other one get bigger?

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Carol and Susan are showing off Ben to the gang.]

events.event_description: Monica enters carrying a pair of expensive Nike shoes and comments on their cost and likelihood of outgrowing them quickly.
Phoebe notices the Nike shoes and comments on them, addressing Ben and joking about the phrase 'Just do it'.
Ben starts to cry after Phoebe's comment, prompting Phoebe to question if she applied too much pressure.
Susan asks if Ben is hungry, and Carol begins to breastfeed Ben.
Chandler notices Carol breastfeeding Ben and comments on the situation, then leaves to the kitchen.
Joey joins Chandler in the kitchen and expresses interest in getting a spoon.
Ross questions Chandler and Joey about their behavior near the baby, emphasizing that breastfeeding is natural and normal.
Ross explains to Chandler and Joey that breastfeeding will happen frequently and encourages them to ask questions if uncomfortable.
Joey asks Carol if breastfeeding hurts, and Carol responds that it did at first but no longer does.
Joey asks Carol if blowing into one breast causes the other to get bigger, prompting a humorous response.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, the gang is all there.]

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: Rachel, do you have any muffins left?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, I forget which ones.

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: Oh, you're busy, that's ok, I'll get it. Anybody else want one?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: No thanks.

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: (To Rachel) Oh, you're losin' your apron here, let me get it. There you go. (Ties it back up for her)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (to Julie) Thank you. (under her breath to Chandler) What a bitch.

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: Oh, listen you guys. I have this friend at Bloomingdale's who's quitting tomorrow and he wants to abuse his discount. So, anyone want to come with me and take advantage of it?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I can't, I have to take my grandmother to the vet.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ok, um, I'll go with you.

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: Great.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (enters) Hi, honey.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, sweetums.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hello to the rest.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hi!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Monica what're you doin'? You can't go shopping with her? What about Rachel?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It's gonna be a problem, isn't it?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Come on, you're going to Bloomingdale's with Julie? That's like cheating on Rachel in her house of worship.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: But I'm...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Monica, she will kill you. She will kill you like a dog in the street.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to Monica) So, uh, Jules tells me you guys are going shopping tomorrow?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, uh, it's actually not that big a deal.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: It's a big deal to me. This is great, Monica. I really appreciate this.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You're welcome.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Woof, woof.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, the gang is all there.]

events.event_description: Julie asks Rachel if she has any muffins left.
Rachel responds that she forgets which muffins she has.
Julie offers to get a muffin for herself after Rachel indicates she's busy.
Julie ties Rachel's apron back onto her.
Rachel silently thanks Julie and mutters about her.
Julie invites the group to join her at Bloomingdale's to take advantage of a discount.
Phoebe declines to go shopping because she has to take her grandmother to the vet.
Monica agrees to go shopping with Julie.
Ross enters the scene and greets the group.
Chandler comments on Monica going to Bloomingdale's with Julie as being like cheating on Rachel in her house of worship.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: A Department Store, Joey is selling men's cologne.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (A guy walks by) Bijan for men? (Another guy walks by) Bijan for men? (Another guy walks by) Bijan for men? (An attractive woman walks by.) Hey Annabelle.

dialogue.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogue.text: Hey, Joey. So did you hear about the new guy?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Who?

dialogue.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogue.text: Nobody knows his name. Me and the girls just call him the Hombre man.

dialogue.speaker: HOMBRE MAN
dialogue.text: (to a customer) Hombre? (The guy says yes, and gets his sample.)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What's he doin' in my section?

dialogue.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogue.text: I guess he doesn't know.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, he's gonna. I'll see you a little later, ok? (To the Hombre Man) Hey, how ya doin'?

dialogue.speaker: HOMBRE MAN
dialogue.text: Mornin'.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Listen, I know you're new, but it's kinda understood that everything from Young Men's to the escalator is my territory.

dialogue.speaker: HOMBRE MAN
dialogue.text: Your territory, huh?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah. Bijan for men?

dialogue.speaker: GUY
dialogue.text: No thanks.

dialogue.speaker: HOMBRE MAN
dialogue.text: Hombre?

dialogue.speaker: GUY
dialogue.text: Yeah. All right. (They guy gets his sample and leaves.)

dialogue.speaker: HOMBRE MAN
dialogue.text: (To Joey) You were saying?

scenes.event_description: [Scene: A Department Store, Joey is selling men's cologne.]

events.event_description: Joey walks by and asks two passing men if they want 'Bijan for men' cologne.
An attractive woman walks past Joey and Annabelle, and Joey greets Annabelle.
Annabelle asks Joey if he heard about the new guy.
Annabelle informs Joey that she and the girls call the new guy the 'Hombre man'.
Hombre Man approaches a customer and offers him a sample of 'Hombre' cologne.
Joey questions Hombre Man about his presence in his section of the store.
Hombre Man responds to Joey, indicating he is aware of the territorial comment.
A man declines a sample when offered by Hombre Man.
Hombre Man confirms with the man that he wants the 'Hombre' cologne sample.
The man takes the sample and leaves the store.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is there as Monica enters.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Phoebe, listen. You were with me, and we were shopping all day.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: We were shopping, and we had lunch.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, all right. What did I have?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You had a salad.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, no wonder I don't feel full.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey, guys, what's up.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I went shopping with Monica all day, and I had a salad.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Good, Pheebs. What'd you buy?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Um, we went shopping for um, for, fur.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You went shopping for fur?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yes, and then I realized I'm against that, and uh, so then we bought some, (sees Monica pointing at her chest) uh, boobs.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You bought boobs?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (Monica is yanking on her bra strap) Bras! We bought bras! We bought bras.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is there as Monica enters.]

events.event_description: Monica informs Phoebe that they were shopping all day and had lunch together.
Phoebe questions what she ate during the shopping and lunch.
Monica confirms Phoebe had a salad during lunch.
Phoebe comments that she doesn't feel full after eating a salad.
Rachel enters the scene and asks what is happening.
Phoebe states she went shopping with Monica all day and had a salad.
Rachel asks what Phoebe bought during shopping.
Phoebe initially says they went shopping for fur, then corrects herself.
Phoebe clarifies that they bought bras after realizing they were against fur shopping.
Monica yanks on Phoebe's bra strap to indicate they bought bras.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Department Store, Joey is trying to sell some cologne.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (to a guy) Bijan for men? (to a guy) Bijan for men? (To a woman) Bijan for... (Sees it's a woman and stops.) (To Annabelle who walks up.) Hey, Annabelle, Uh, listen, I was wondering if maybe after work you and I could go maybe grab a cup of coffee.

dialogue.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogue.text: Oh, actually I sorta have plans.

dialogue.speaker: HOMBRE MAN
dialogue.text: (entering) Ready, Annabelle?

dialogue.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogue.text: You bet. (to Joey) Maybe some other time?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (To a co-worker) Hey, it's not the first time I lost a girl to a cowboy spraying cologne. (A customer walks by.) Bijan for men? (The customer ignores him, and Joey starts to chase him) Bijan for men?!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: The Department Store, Joey is trying to sell some cologne.]

events.event_description: Joey approaches a customer and offers Bijan for men cologne.
Joey notices Annabelle walking up and addresses her.
Joey asks Annabelle if she wants to go for coffee after work.
Annabelle declines Joey's invitation, citing prior plans.
Hombre Man enters and calls Annabelle, indicating readiness.
Annabelle agrees to leave with Hombre Man.
Annabelle tells Joey she will see him some other time.
Joey comments to a co-worker about losing girls to cowboys spraying cologne.
Joey attempts to sell cologne to a passing customer.
Joey chases after the customer, calling out 'Bijan for men!'

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Carol is dropping Ben off for Ross to watch.]

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Ok, and this is Funny Clown. Funny Clown is only for after his naps, not before his naps or he won't sleep.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Carol, we've been through this before, ok? We have a good time. We laugh, we play. It's like we're father and son.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Honey, relax. Ross is great with him. (Ross looks at her.) Don't look so surprised. I'm a lovely person.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, this is so cute.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Oh, I got that for him.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: My mommies love me. That's clever.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hello? Oh, Hi, Ju—(Sees Rachel is watching)—Hi, Jew! (Walks into the kitchen.) (Listens.) Uh huh? (Listens.) Uh huh? (Listens) Ok. (Listens) Um, sure, that'd be great. See ya then. Bye. (Hangs up.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Did you just say Hi, Jew?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yes. Uh, yes, I did. That was my friend, Eddie Moskowitz. Yeah, he likes it. Reaffirms his faith.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Carol is dropping Ben off for Ross to watch.]

events.event_description: Carol drops off Ben at Monica and Rachel's apartment for Ross to watch.
Carol instructs Ross about the use of Funny Clown for Ben after his naps.
Ross assures Carol that he and Ben have a good time playing and laughing together.
Susan defends Ross's parenting skills to Carol.
Ross comments that his mommies love him and finds it clever.
Monica receives a phone call from her friend Eddie Moskowitz and listens to his message.
Monica responds to Rachel's question by confirming she said 'Hi, Jew' to her friend Eddie.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler, Rachel, and Joey are eating, and Phoebe is
preparing Ben's milk.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ben, dinner!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Thanks Aunt Pheebs. Hey, you didn't microwave that, did you, because it's breast milk, and you're not supposed to do that.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Duh, I think I know how to heat breast milk. Ok. (Squirts some on her wrist and tastes it.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What did you just do?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I licked my arm, what?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: It's breast milk.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: So?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Phoebe, that is juice, squeezed from a person.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What is the big deal? (Tastes the breast milk.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What did you just do?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ok, would people stop drinking the breast milk?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You won't even taste it?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Not even if you just pretend that it's milk?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Not even if Carol's breast had a picture of a missing child on it.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler, Rachel, and Joey are eating, and Phoebe is
preparing Ben's milk.]

events.event_description: Phoebe calls Ben to dinner.
Phoebe thanks Aunt Pheebs for the breast milk.
Ross questions Phoebe about microwaving the breast milk.
Phoebe tastes her arm to check the temperature of the breast milk.
Chandler asks Phoebe what she just did.
Phoebe admits she licked her arm.
Ross clarifies that the liquid is breast milk.
Phoebe questions the others about tasting the breast milk.
Joey tastes the breast milk.
Ross insists that people should not drink the breast milk.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, time lapse.  Rachel is entering the living room from
her bedroom as Monica enters.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey, where is everybody?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: They took Ben to the park. Where've you been?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Just out. Had some lunch, just me, little quality time with me. Thanks for your jacket.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, no problem. You can borrow it, by the way. (Puts her hand in the pocket) Here are your keys, hon. (She takes the keys out, sets them on the counter, and notices she also grabbed a receipt.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Mon, if uh you were at lunch alone, how come it cost you uh 53 dollars?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You know what probably happened? Someone musta stolen my credit card.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: And sorta just put the receipt back in your pocket?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That is an excellent excellent question. That is excellent.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Monica, what is with you? Who'd you have lunch with?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Judy.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Who?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Julie.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Jody!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You were with Julie?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Look, when it started I was just trying to be nice to her because she was my brother's girlfriend. And then, one thing led to another and, before I knew it, we were...shopping.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh. Oh my God.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Honey, wait. We only did it once. It didn't mean anything to me.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, right. Sure!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Really, Rachel, I was thinking of you the whole time. Look, I'm sorry, all right. I never meant for you to find out!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, please, you wanted to get caught. (Waves the receipt)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That is not true!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, so you just sort of happened to leave it in here?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Did it ever occur to you that I might just be that stupid?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ok, Monica. I just have to know one thing. Did you go with her to Bloomingdale's ? (Monica looks away.) Oh! Ok, ok, ok, I just really, uh, I just really need to not be with you right now. (Exits.)

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, time lapse.  Rachel is entering the living room from
her bedroom as Monica enters.]

events.event_description: Rachel enters the living room from her bedroom.
Monica enters the living room.
Rachel asks Monica about the whereabouts of everyone.
Monica explains she was out having lunch alone and thanks Rachel for her jacket.
Rachel notices she also grabbed a receipt while returning Monica's keys.
Rachel questions Monica about the $53 lunch expense, suggesting her credit card was stolen.
Monica admits she was with Julie, mistaking her for Judy, and mentions shopping together.
Rachel reacts with shock and disbelief upon learning about Monica's outing with Julie.
Monica tries to reassure Rachel that their outing was only once and meant nothing.
Rachel, upset, questions if Monica went to Bloomingdale's with Julie and then leaves the scene.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ben is playing in his crib while Chandler and Ross are
leaning against the rim and are completely asleep.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (on the phone) Hi, who's this? (Listens) Hi, Joanne. Is Rachel working? It's Monica. (Listens) Yes, I know I did a horrible thing. (Listens) Joanne, it's not as simple as all that, ok? (Listens) No, I don't care what Steve thinks. (Listens) Hi, Steve.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL AND SUSAN
dialogue.text: Hey! (This wakes Chandler and Ross up)

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: How did we do?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, I tasted Ben's milk, and Ross freaked out.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I did not freak out.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Why'd you freak out?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Because it's breast milk. It's gross.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: My breast milk is gross?

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: This should be fun.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, no, Carol. There's nothing wrong with it. I just, I just don't think breast milk is for adults.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Of course the packaging does appeal to grown-ups and kids alike.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Ross, you're being silly. I've tried it, it's no big deal. Just taste it. (Holding out a bottle.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (jumping away) That would be no.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Come on. It doesn't taste bad.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's kinda sweet, sorta like, uh...

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Cantaloupe juice.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Exactly.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (staring at Susan) You've tasted it? You've tasted it.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Uh huh.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, you've tasted it.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: You can keep saying it, but it won't stop being true.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (he rolls up his sleeve) Gimme the bottle. (Joey hands him the bottle and Ross squirts some on his arm.) Gimme the towel. (Joey gives him the towel and he wipes it off.)

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ben is playing in his crib while Chandler and Ross are
leaning against the rim and are completely asleep.]

events.event_description: Monica answers the phone and speaks with Joanne, discussing Rachel's work status and expressing concern about a previous mistake.
Carol and Susan arrive and greet the others, causing Chandler and Ross to wake up.
Carol offers Ross a bottle of Ben’s breast milk, encouraging him to taste it.
Ross reacts negatively to the idea of tasting Ben's breast milk, jumping away and refusing to try it.
Phoebe encourages Ross to taste the breast milk, claiming it doesn't taste bad.
Joey describes the taste of the breast milk as being similar to cantaloupe juice.
Susan admits to having tasted Ben's breast milk, surprising Ross.
Ross squirts some of Ben’s breast milk onto his arm to test its taste, then wipes it off with a towel.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is wiping down the peninsula counter as Joey
enters dressed like a cowboy.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Howdy.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (sitting on the otherside of the counter from Chandler) Gimme a box a juice. Well, they switched me over to Hombre.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, maybe it's because of the way you're dressed.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Or maybe it's because this guy's doing so good they wanna put more people on it. (Chandler pours some juice in a glass.) You should see this guy, Chandler, he goes through two bottles a day.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (slides the juice across the counter which Joey catches) What do you care? You're an actor. This is your day job. This isn't supposed to mean anything to you.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I know, but, I was the best, you know? I liked being the best. (He downs the glass of juice in one swig.) I don't know. Maybe I should just get outta the game. They need guys up in housewares to serve cheese.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (pours more and slides the refill to Joey) All right, say you do that. You know sooner or later somebody's gonna come along that slices a better cheddar. And then where're you gonna run?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah I guess you're right.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You're damn right I'm right. I say you show this guy what you're made of. I say you stand your ground. I say you show him that you are the baddest hombre west of the lingerie.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I'm gonna do it. (He downs the juice in one swig again.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: All right. Now go see Miss Kitty and she'll fix you up with a nice hooker.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is wiping down the peninsula counter as Joey
enters dressed like a cowboy.]

events.event_description: Chandler wipes down the peninsula counter.
Joey enters the scene dressed like a cowboy.
Joey requests a box of juice from Chandler.
Joey states he has been switched to the Hombre project.
Chandler comments that Joey's dressing might be the reason for the switch.
Joey suggests that his success on the Hombre project is why he's being promoted.
Chandler pours juice into a glass and slides it to Joey.
Joey drinks the juice in one gulp and expresses his desire to leave the acting profession.
Chandler advises Joey that someone better might replace him in his current job.
Joey decides to stay and prove himself, then drinks more juice.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Outside Central Perk, Rachel is cleaning up and Monica is pleading with her.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I don't know what else to say.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well that works out good, because I'm not listening.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I feel terrible, I really do.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, I'm sorry, did my back hurt your knife?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Rachel, (they go back inside) say that I'm friends with her, we spend some time together. Is that so terrible?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yes.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It's that terrible?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yes. Monica, you don't get it. It's bad enough that she's stolen the guy who might actually be the person that I am supposed to be with, but now, she's actually (starting to cry), but now she's actually stealing you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Me? What are you talking about? Nobody could steal me from you. I mean, just because I'm friends with her doesn't make me any less friends with you. I mean, (starting to cry) you're my...We're, we're...Oh, I love you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I love you too. (They hug.)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You guys, um I know that this really doesn't have anything to do with me, but um I love you guys too. (Joins in on the hug.) Oh, I really needed that. (Goes and sits down.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Look, I know that you're in a place right now where you really need to hate Julie's guts, but she didn't do anything wrong. I mean, she was just a girl who met a guy, and now they go out. I really think that if you gave her a chance, you'd like her. Would you just give that a chance, for me?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (crying) I'd do anything for you, you know that.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (crying) I'd do anything for you. (They hug again.)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Wait, wait, wait, wait! (Runs over and joins in on the hug again.)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Outside Central Perk, Rachel is cleaning up and Monica is pleading with her.]

events.event_description: Monica pleads with Rachel to see her perspective and ask her to consider their friendship with Julie.
Rachel dismisses Monica's plea by stating she is not listening.
Monica expresses her feelings of guilt and sadness about the situation.
Rachel sarcastically responds to Monica's feelings, implying her back hurt her when Monica tried to argue.
Monica asks Rachel to acknowledge that she and Julie are friends and spend time together, questioning if that is so terrible.
Rachel firmly states that having a friendship with Julie is terrible and that she is stealing Monica from her.
Rachel begins to cry, expressing her feelings of betrayal and loss due to Julie's involvement with Monica.
Monica reassures Rachel that Julie did not do anything wrong and asks her to give Julie a chance.
Rachel agrees to do anything for Monica, expressing her love and willingness to reconcile.
Monica and Rachel hug each other, reaffirming their friendship, with Phoebe joining the hug to support them.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The Department Store, Joey and the Hombre man are facing off in Joey's
section.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Mornin'. (The Hombre man ignores him) I said, mornin'.

dialogue.speaker: HOMBRE MAN
dialogue.text: I heard ya.

dialogue.speaker: STORE GUY
dialogue.text: All right, everybody, I'm openin' the doors. You boys ready?

dialogue.speaker: HOMBRE MAN
dialogue.text: Ready.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, I'm ready.

dialogue.speaker: CUSTOMER
dialogue.text: You idiot, you stupid cowboy, you blinded me, I'm suing!

dialogue.speaker: STORE GUY
dialogue.text: Oh my god, Todd! What the hell did you do?

dialogue.speaker: HOMBRE MAN
dialogue.text: I'm sorry. I am such a doofus. I'm so sorry, I'm so sorry.

dialogue.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogue.text: (seeing the end result) My god, what happened?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: These new kids, they never last. Sooner or later, they all...stop lastin'. Listen, uh, what do you say I buy you that cup of coffee now?

dialogue.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogue.text: Sure.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: The Department Store, Joey and the Hombre man are facing off in Joey's
section.]

events.event_description: Joey greets the Hombre man with 'Mornin'' but is ignored by him.
Joey repeats his greeting 'I said, mornin'' to the Hombre man.
Store Guy announces that he is opening the doors and asks if the characters are ready.
Hombre man responds that he is ready.
Joey confirms he is ready.
Customer insults Joey and the Hombre man, claiming he was blinded and threatening to sue.
Store Guy reacts with concern, asking Todd what he did.
Hombre man apologizes, calling himself a doofus and expressing remorse.
Annabelle observes the scene and questions what happened.
Joey comments on the durability of new kids and offers to buy Annabelle a coffee.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Julie and Rachel are sitting on the couch.]

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: So.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: So. I just thought the two of us should hang out for a bit. I mean, you know, we've never really talked. I guess you'd know that, being one of the two of us, though, right?

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: I know, I probably shouldn't even tell you this, but I'm pretty much totally intimidated by you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Really? Me?

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: Yes. Oh my god, are you kidding? Ross is so crazy about you, and I really wanted you to like me, and, it's probably me being totally paranoid, but I kinda got the feeling that maybe you don't.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, you're not totally paranoid.

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: Oy.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Um, ok, uh, oh god, um, when you and uh Ross first started going out, it was really hard for me, um, for many reasons, which I'm not gonna bore you with now, but um, I just, I see how happy he is, you know, and how good you guys are together, and um, Monica's always saying how nice you are, and god I hate it when she's right.

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: Thanks. Hey, listen, would you like to go to a movie sometime or something?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, that'd be great. I'd love it.

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: I'd love it too. Shoot, I gotta go. So, I'll talk to you later.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: All right, Julie.

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: Bye. (Gets up.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Bye. (After Julie exits.) What a manipulative bitch.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Julie and Rachel are sitting on the couch.]

events.event_description: Julie initiates a conversation by saying 'So.'
Rachel expresses her desire to hang out and mentions they haven't talked much before.
Julie admits she is intimidated by Rachel.
Rachel responds that she is surprised Julie feels that way.
Julie reveals she is attracted to Rachel and worries Rachel doesn't like her back.
Rachel confirms that Julie's feelings are not entirely paranoid.
Rachel shares her feelings about Ross and Julie, indicating she finds Julie's behavior hard to handle.
Julie asks Rachel if she would like to go to a movie together.
Rachel agrees to go to a movie with Julie.
Julie decides to leave the scene and says goodbye.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, another showdown is occuring, only this time
its between Ross, a plate of cookies, and the breast milk.  They've been eyeing each
other for a while now, and Chandler and Joey are getting bored.  He checks his Ross
and in frustration, shoves his watch in front of Ross's eyes as if saying, "Hurry it
up already!"  Finally, Ross scratches his head, does that again, itches his
nose, scratches his head, grabs the bottle, takes a big swig, and piles several cookies
into his mouth.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (with a mouthful) That's not bad.

[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, another showdown is occuring, only this time
its between Ross, a plate of cookies, and the breast milk.  They've been eyeing each
other for a while now, and Chandler and Joey are getting bored.  He checks his Ross
and in frustration, shoves his watch in front of Ross's eyes as if saying, "Hurry it
up already!"  Finally, Ross scratches his head, does that again, itches his
nose, scratches his head, grabs the bottle, takes a big swig, and piles several cookies
into his mouth.]

events.event_description: Ross scratches his head during the scene.
Ross scratches his head again.
Ross itches his nose.
Ross grabs the bottle of breast milk and takes a big swig.
Ross piles several cookies into his mouth.
Ross comments, '(with a mouthful) That's not bad.'
